DOC.detailed_description: This study test whether exposure therapy fear snake spider enhance addition brief fear retrieval trial prior treatment , use compound extinction treatment . The goal study determine whether behavioral technique enhance efficacy exposure therapy , one empirically support treatment anxiety disorder . Individuals age 18-65 elevated fear spider fear snake randomly assign one four treatment condition ( 1 ) standard exposure therapy , ( 2 ) exposure therapy fear retrieval augmentation , ( 3 ) exposure therapy compound extinction augmentation , ( 4 ) exposure therapy fear retrieval compound extinction augmentation . All participant undergo online prescreen face-to-face screening assessment determine eligibility baseline ( pre-treatment ) symptom severity . Participants additionally complete assessment directly treatment ( post-treatment ) , approximately one week treatment ( follow-up ) . The pre-treatment assessment occur 1-14 day prior treatment , post-treatment assessment occur treatment visit soon treatment procedure complete , follow-up assessment occur within window 6-14 day completion treatment . Participants complete two behavioral approach test ( treatment context generalization context ) pre-treatment , post-treatment , follow-up . Participants complete battery self-report questionnaire pre-treatment follow-up .
